means: 敲诈( extort的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Her kidnapper successfully extorted a £75,000 ransom for her release.
sentence.Network_cn: 绑匪成功地勒索了7.5万英镑才将她释放。

sentence.Network_en: The gang extorted money from over 30 local businesses.
sentence.Network_cn: 这帮歹徒向当地30多户商家勒索过钱财。

sentence.Network_en: He extorted a promise from me.

PerfectNetExp.abs: ... encryption keys。但系，就算一串「强」密码都可能被人偷、呃、逼供（extorted）出来、用键盘 logger收集、传送途中截听、或者 …
extorted by gangsters on threat of violence ., 被歹徒用暴力威胁敲诈去的钱财.
According to newspaper , we can find someone extorted , kidnapped , robbed , even killed almost every day ., 根据报纸报导 , 我们几乎每天可以发现有人被勒索 , 绑架 , 抢劫甚至被杀害.

list.abs: external genital warts 外生殖器疣extortion plot 勒索阴谋extra label “特别标签”
such stunts happen at the murkier end of internet commerce : for instance , to extort money an online casino .这些绝招之所以能奏效源于电子商务中存在错误的漏洞-比如，可以向网络夜总会赌场进行敲诈金钱。
Whitewashed official complicity in political extortion ., 掩饰政治纠纷中的官方冲突.
索取 ： extort索取贿赂 ： extort bribe索取贿赂 ： solicit bribe

entry.def: If someone extorts money from you, they get it from you using force, threats, or other unfair or illegal means.

example.ex: Corrupt government officials were extorting money from him...
example.tran: 腐败的政府官员向他敲诈钱财。

example.ex: Her kidnapper extorted a £75,000 ransom for her release.
example.tran: 绑架者索要75,000英镑赎金才肯放她。

entry.def: If someone extorts something from you, they get it from you with difficulty or by using unfair means.

example.ex: Some magistrates have abused their powers of arrest to extort confessions.
example.tran: 有些地方执法官滥用逮捕权进行逼供。

auth_sentence.content: It killed hundreds of people and extorted vast sums from its own community.
auth_sentence.res_content: It killed hundreds of people and extorted vast sums from its own community.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It killed hundreds of people and extorted vast sums from its own community.

auth_sentence.content: Adolescent ruffians who extorted pennies and apples from tradesmen in return for not breaking their windows.
auth_sentence.res_content: Adolescent ruffians who extorted pennies and apples from tradesmen in return for not breaking their windows.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Adolescent ruffians who extorted pennies and apples from tradesmen in return for not breaking their windows.

auth_sentence.content: Mary...only finally married him when consent had been extorted from Mr. Ponsonby on his deathbed.
auth_sentence.res_content: Mary...only finally married him when consent had been extorted from Mr. Ponsonby on his deathbed.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Mary...only finally married him when consent had been extorted from Mr. Ponsonby on his deathbed.
